Reviews.Title: Verizon version is no good
Reviews.Author: Frank Rizzo
Reviews.Content: If you're interested in this phone, I do not recommend the Verizon version. Verizon has crippled the software and will not provide any valid reason or a way to unlock the full potential of this device. If you like this phone, you will be better off getting it on AT&T; or T-Mobile's network, because they have not crippled the software. Even Google Wallet is disallowed on this device, which is touted as having "NFC" capabilities, a very cool and convenient feature that Verizon has blocked out. The Sprint version allows you to utilize your phone's NFC chip with Google Wallet to make purchases at stores with paypass scanners. If you buy the Verizon version your NFC chip will go to waste and the full potential to customize your phone will not be available to you unless Verizon decides to change their mind about this.

Reviews.Title: Locked bootloader.
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone, but lets face it, it is severely handicapped with a locked bootloader. I would strongly consider getting a different device, or better yet, moving to a different provider if on verizon wireless.

Reviews.Title: Dont buy!
Reviews.Author: Amore
Reviews.Content: Please don't buy the Verizon version of this phone its got a locked boot loader and Verizon is the only company to do this. if you want this phone At&t;, Sprint and t-mobile are all unlocked and better..

Reviews.Title: NEW Verizon customer and already feel locked down
Reviews.Author: Devin
Reviews.Content: Coming from Sprint I thought I was going to have a better experience with Verizon! So far signal wise I do i'll give them that. HOWEVER! With Sprint I was able to use my Samsung Epic Touch 4G to it's full extent because it was mine and did not contain a locked down bootloader! Not to mention I can't even use Google Wallet which is an awesome feature! Wish I could use it. If anyone is looking at different carriers and Verizon as a possible option, if you care at all about your phone, I would highly not recommend Verzion! Their reasoning behind locking the bootloader on the Samsung Galaxy SIII, to maintain the "said" great customer support and solid network performance is a full faced excuse! Verizon's response? Oh it's Samsungs fault, they wanted to lock the bootloader... Ok Verizon get real, there are three other U.S. Carriers and ALL three of them have the SGSIII bootloader UNLOCKED, if this was the case, I'm pretty sure Samsung would have kept it that way across the board. Verizon's second response, oh ok well we can offer to sell a developer edition phone with an unlocked bootloader at a marked up price! NO! NO ONE is going to buy the developer edition especially after pre-ordering a device that should have been unlocked in the first place! Verizon I hope you can somehow make this right as I will not stay a customer for very long, nor will my family.

Reviews.Title: Phone is great but Verizon messed up
Reviews.Author: Slinger05
Reviews.Content: This phone has so much more potential.  I bought this phone thinking the bootloader would be unlocked but come to find out its been blocked by Verizon, not Samsung.  I'll probably return it since they decided to block the bootloader and go with another carrier.  Nice move Verizon.  You pulled a fast one on your customers.

Reviews.Title: Verizon is terrible
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: Great phone, verizon's bloat software is horrible, the ongoing wifi notification they've added is unacceptable, and the locked bootloader is downright criminal...

Reviews.Title: nice phone horrible software
Reviews.Author: Hawkins
Reviews.Content: This the same phone as Sprint AT&T; and T Mobile but Verizon changed the software crippling it's potential and ruining an otherwise good phone.  Just about every single app I download for it that is listed to work on the Galaxy S3 doesn't.  I have contacted three of the developers (people who wrote the apps) and they all told me the Verizon version of this phone is nothing but a head ache for developers its software is a nightmare.  I have had to Factory reset my phone four times because of these incompatibility reasons.  I contacted Verizon and they told me the software is different because of security reasons???? and that using software like the other companies use (Sprint AT&T; and T Mobile) will diminish the Android experience!  Being able to use half the apps that the other phones have and having your phone lock up on half of the ones you are told you can down load....what an experience nice work Verizon.  If you really want this phone don't get the Verizon version you will regret it I certainly do.

Reviews.Title: Great phone...by a provider that doesn't care about its customers
Reviews.Author: K3
Reviews.Content: I got this phone anticipating it for months...I pre-oredered it so I received it early only to find out...verizon put an encryption on its bootloader...but wait AT&T; unlockable bootloader...T-MOBILE unlockable bootloader...Sprint unlockable bootloader...International version unlockable bootloader...this just goes to show you verizon loves being the big boys and pushing lies down peoples throat as long as they make $$$. And the funniest part is they said unlocking the bootloader can cause damage to their network yet now samsung is releasing a DEVELOPER EDITION with an unlockable bootloader on VERIZON WIRELESS...well VERIZON what happened to harming your network you obviously had to give that the OK to use on your network proving your feeding us nothing but lies...thanks again verizon for ruining something that could of been great.

Reviews.Title: Very Good
Reviews.Author: Ashley Harris
Reviews.Content: The phone came in quick and everything was in great condition when I received it. Love the GSIII and this was a great way to get one for cheaper than a Verizon store would offer after mine got stolen.

Reviews.Title: Good phone, good condition
Reviews.Author: Kathryne Ogrod
Reviews.Content: Got the phone on time, no damage, and it works great! I am now very happy with my new phone!!

Reviews.Title: locked bootloader HA!
Reviews.Author: jsgentry75
Reviews.Content: I unlocked mine in 15 minutes, and yes it's a verizon model.  Also the NFC Chip works fine with mine.  If you know what you're doing locked bootloaders are a minor inconvenience.  Yes I do agree they are getting more strict and difficult but it is still possible if you keep up with the latest exploits.  I will admit I do wish Samsung would get with the program like HTC and support development but what can you do.  Anyway...
